node.statement: BASE CASE n=2: When n=2, for p with roots a<b and q with roots c<d, an explicit computation shows r = p âŠž_2 q has discriminant (a-b)^2 + (c-d)^2, giving Phi_2(r) = 2/((a-b)^2+(c-d)^2) while 1/Phi_2(p) + 1/Phi_2(q) = (a-b)^2/2 + (c-d)^2/2 = ((a-b)^2+(c-d)^2)/2 = 1/Phi_2(r). Thus equality holds for n=2.
